answers.answer: Hi,How are you? What other symptoms are present? Irregular menstruation  and headache may be attributed to hormonal changes at this time of perimenopause.  Aside from this, medications side effect, changes in exercise routine, diet changes, gynecological issues such as endometrial hyperplasia, polyps and fibroids or infection, and underlying medial conditions such as thyroid and pituitary disorders, diabetes, cirrhosis of the liver, and systemic lupus erythematosus may also be responsible. Ice pack, pain medications and rest may help provide symptomatic relief. If this persists, it is best that you have this checked by your gynecologist for proper evaluation. Take care and do keep us posted.

question: Iam 37 my preiods are light for the frist day than heavy for three than gos away for a day than comes back dose that for about four days but i have a headace all this time and sick any advice
title: headace
